reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The regional manager visits target countries 1-2 times a year. A training and recreational event is organised on a yearly basis for Finnish staff. Partners’ networking is supported by, for example training material exchanges and organising partnership se minars. The project has a project assistant, who, in addition to assistant’s work, especially attends to peace-building issues in the target region. Regional coordination is a part of Fida’s strategy to decentralise administration. Project staff need g uidance and support in their work, especially in building local partnerships. Partners’ working capacity is limited and they do not have strong networks. Direct beneficiaries in the project are the key actors of the partners, which are about 15 people. T he project aims at enabling the partners to do social work in cooperation with other actors, which holistically benefits the target communities. The purpose of the project is to support Fida’s Finnish staff and the partners’ mutual networking in the re gion’s different countries. As a result of the project, staff’s management is improved. Project planning, tracking and assessment become more effective. Partners’ working capacity increases. The starting of action (Afghanistan) and the concluding of it (Jordan, Palestinian territories) occur smoothly. The region’s humanitarian situation is assessed and the partners are equipped for action. The understanding of peace building increases.
